business.headline: Will retail inflation cool down further in January? Here's all you need to know The RBI mentioned continued reduction in rice prices and sharp corrections in the prices of vegetables, especially in the prices of onions, potatoes and tomatoes, in its January 2025 Bulletin.

L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan blames welfare schemes for labour shortage in IndiaSpeaking at CII's Mystic South Global Linkages Summit 2025 in Chennai, Subrahmanyan spoke about the difficulties faced by the construction industry in hiring and mobilising workers.

Sensex falls 700 points: 4 reasons why stock market is falling todayStock market crash: The S&P BSE Sensex plunged over 850 points before trimming some losses, trading 748.13 points lower at 75,545.47 by 10:23 am. The NSE Nifty50 also slipped nearly 1%, reflecting weakness across broader markets.
Sensex tumbles over 850 points as US tariff fears spook Dalal StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex nosedived 834.39 points to 75,459.21 at 10 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 251.95  points to trade at 22,819.85.

Madhya Pradesh: Rs 1,553 crore for Ladli Behna Yojana released. Check eligibilityLadli Behna Yojana aims to improve women's well-being, health, nutrition and economic independence. Presently, Rs 1,250 per month is given to all the eligible women under this scheme.

8th Pay Commission: Will its implementation face delays?Despite several measures announced for taxpayers in the Union Budget 2025, there was no mention of the financial impact of implementing the 8th Pay Commission.

Are you eligible for fixed medical allowance under NPS? Check details Retired central government civilian employees who are covered under the National Pension System will now be eligible for fixed medical allowance, announced the Department of Pension & Pensioners' Welfare.

Sensex ends 1,000 points lower: 5 factors behind today's stock market crashInvestors lost nearly Rs 10 lakh crore as selling pressure intensified across sectors due to various factors that dampened investor sentiment.

Sensex falls 1,000 points, investors lose Rs 10 lakh crore on Dalal StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex tanked by 1,1018.20 points to end at 76,293.60, while the NSE Nifty50 fell by 309.80 points to close at 23,071.80.

India's inflation likely to dip to a 5-month low of 4.60% in January: ReportThe country's consumer inflation is expected to fall to a five-month low of 4.60% in January 2025, as compared to 5.22% which was recorded in December last year, as per Reuters.

India to keep ban on Chinese investments for now, says Chief Economic AdviserSpeaking at an event in Mumbai on Tuesday, Chief Economic Adviser (CEA) V. Anantha Nageswaran said that any changes to the current restrictions would take time and require a deeper understanding between both countries.

Coimbatore company rewards employees with Rs 14.5 crore bonus. Here's whyA few days ago, the CEO, Saravana Kumar, formally announced the release of the bonus. He shared that he deliberately did not choose to offer employee stock options (ESOPS) or performance-based incentives.

Hotmail co-founder Sabeer Bhatia critisises Aadhaar and UPI in a podcast Sabeer Bhatia mentioned that the use of video and voiceprint technology for the Aadhaar project, which is already embedded in smartphones, could have been a better approach which could have achieved the same results at much lower costs.

Not Mumbai or Bengaluru, this Indian city leads in luxury home price surgeMumbai, traditionally known for its expensive real estate, was placed seventh in the global rankings for luxury home price surge.

Sensex crashes over 1,000 points: What's behind today's stock market bloodbath?Stock market crash: At 1:12 pm, the Sensex was down 1051.88 points to 76,261.90, and the Nifty fell 321.15 points to 23,060.45. Most broader market indices were also in the red as volatility spiked sharply.

New Income Tax Bill expected soon: Here's what taxpayers can expect The new bill aims to make direct tax laws simpler, reduce litigation, and remove ambiguities in the current system. Experts believe it will be easier to understand, more user-friendly, and free of unnecessary complexities.

Sacked Infosys trainees share ordeal after mass termination: 'This is inhumane'The sacked trainee employees, who were onboarded after 2.5 years of wait, were called in batches of 50 starting from 9.30 am on February 7. They were escorted to a room guarded by security and bouncers where they were made to sign a mutual separation letter.

PM Modi inaugurates India Energy Week 2025, outlines green energy targetsPrime Minister Narendra Modi virtually launched India Energy Week 2025, reaffirming India's commitment to green energy. He announced plans to add 500 GW of renewable capacity and outlined ambitious 2030 sustainability goals, citing India's strong track record over the past decade.

Explained: Why Zomato share price plunged over 5% todayZomato stock price: Shares of the company have been under pressure ever since global brokerage firm Jefferies raised concerns over rising competition in the quick commerce space.

India 1st G20 country to achieve Paris Agreement goals, says PM Narendra ModiPrime Minister Narendra Modi also outlined various other green energy targets to achieve by the year 2030, calling them ambitious yet possible given the excellent track record in the past 10 years.

entertainment.headline: Picture This trailer: Simone Ashley, Hero Fiennes to headline new romantic comedyThe trailer for Simone Ashley and Hero Fiennes Tiffin's film, Picture This, has been unveiled. It will release on Prime Video on March 6.

Jackson Wang announces MAGIC MAN 2 – A raw and vulnerable chapterJackson Wang is set to release MAGIC MAN 2, an album that delves into the stages of grief and personal growth. After a year of introspection, he presents a raw and authentic portrayal of his journey.

Pop girl group XG take their 'The first HOWL' World Tour to Latin-America  XG, a dynamic hip-hop/R&B-inspired girl group, is set to captivate audiences in Latin America with their inaugural concerts in Brazil and Mexico. As they continue their world tour, XG unveils a groundbreaking project, 'XDM Unidentified Waves,' that redefines their music and solidifies their global appeal.

Singer Liam Payne was struggling with sexuality, coerced ex to abort: ReportA new report reveals late One Direction star Liam Payne struggled with his sexuality and allegedly pressured ex-fiancée Maya Henry to terminate a pregnancy.

Mukesh Khanna on Ranveer Allahbadia row: Blacken his faceActor Mukesh Khanna has criticised YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia for making explicit remarks on Samay Raina's show, calling for strict punishment to deter such behaviour.

Munawar Faruqui to Vir Das, comedians who landed in trouble for inappropriate jokesAs podcaster Ranveer Allahbadia faces backlash for his obscene jokes on an episode of India's Got Latent, here's a look at other stand-up comedians who have found themselves in trouble.

Diddy allegedly 'drugged and raped' a man, claims new lawsuitMusic mogul Sean Combs is embroiled in fresh legal trouble as an anonymous plaintiff files a sexual assault lawsuit against him in New York.

The phone dropped...: Story of Jitendra Kumar's humility and unassuming successActor Jitendra Kumar, popularly known as Jeetu Bhaiya, says the bigger thing is not to decide whether to take a risk in life or not, but to know what is at stake.

Arunachal women panel condemns Elvish Yadav's 'racist' remarks against Chum DarangThe Arunachal Pradesh State Commission for Women has condemned Elvish Yadav's derogatory remarks against Chum Darang and has demanded strict action. The comments have sparked backlash.

Kadhalikka Neramillai: Nithya Menen, Ravi Mohan's rom-com now streaming on NetflixKadhalikka Neramillai, the heartfelt romantic film, starring Nithya Menen and Ravi Mohan is streaming on OTT. The Tamil film had its theatrical release on January 14.

Suzhal The Vortex Season 2 to premiere on Prime Video this monthA brand-new season of the Tamil Prime Video series, Suzhal: The Vortex, was announced on Tuesday. The show will begin streaming on the OTT platform from this month itself.

Squid Game 3 to have 6 episodes. Fans say 'they better be 2 hours long'Fans of Squid Game are eagerly awaiting the third season. However, the revelation of the season having only six episodes has left many fans disappointed.

Solo Leveling Season 2: Animation peaks as Jinwoo defeats dungeon bossThe latest episode of Solo Leveling peaked with its brilliantly animated fight sequence. In the episode, titled Don't Look Down on My Guys, Sung Jinwoo clashed with Karlgargan.

Uorfi Javed defends friend Samay Raina amid calls for his arrestUorfi Javed slammed people demanding jail time for YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia and comedian Samay Raina after Allahbadia's obscene joke on India's Got Latent went viral.

Samay Raina in Seattle as India's Got Latent and Ranveer Allahbadia face backlashIndian stand-up comedian Samay Raina recently performed in Seattle, as controversies surrounding Ranveer Allahbadia and India's Got Latent stirred social media discussions in India.

Rakhi Sawant asks forgiveness for Ranveer AllahbadiaActor Rakhi Sawant shared a message for fans amid the Ranveer Allahbadia controversy. She requested all to 'forgive' the YouTuber for his recent crass jokes on Samay Raina's show.

Why Sanya Malhotra's Mrs should come with a trigger warningMrs, starring Sanya Malhotra, explores patriarchal society and the struggles of women in arranged marriages. Here's why this movie should come with a trigger warning and must be on your watchlist.

Singer Charlie Puth to Kanye West for selling Swastika T-shirts: I beg you to stopSinger Charlie Puth 'begged' Kanye West to stop after he sold Swastika T-shirts on his website. Kanye's move sparked concern about his 'incredibly dangerous' claims.

Ankita Lokhande tears down Rozlyn Khan's claims about Hina Khan's cancer: So cheapAnkita Lokhande slammed Rozlyn Khan for her claims about Hina Khan's cancer battle. She called out Rozlyn Khan's claims 'cheap'.

Bryan Adams's Australia concert cancelled due to overflowing sewageSinger Bryan Adams's Australia concert was cancelled due to an overflowing sewage issue caused by a "large blockage" of fat, grease, and rags. Adams apologised to fans and assured them that tickets would be refunded.

general news.headline: Mumbai cops get terror threat to PM's plane before US trip, man detained: ReportThe Mumbai Police arrested the person behind the threat call, and it was found that the suspect was mentally ill, ANI quoted Mumbai Police.

Not just laziness: HAL explains delay in Tejas delivery after air chief's rebukeHAL assured that it would soon begin Tejas Mk1A deliveries to the Indian Air Force after resolving technical issues, following the Air Force Chief's remarks expressing "no confidence" in the company.

L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan blames welfare schemes for labour shortage in IndiaSpeaking at CII's Mystic South Global Linkages Summit 2025 in Chennai, Subrahmanyan spoke about the difficulties faced by the construction industry in hiring and mobilising workers.

3rd ODI LIVE: Kohli in focus as India eye perfect Champions Trophy tune-up India (IND) vs England (ENG), 3rd ODI Live updates from Ahmedabad: Virat Kohli will be in focus as India return to Ahmedabad, the venue where they lost the World Cup final two years ago. India will look to win on Wednesday and seal the series 3-0 in the lead-up to the Champions Trophy.

Scared Ram Charan might have daughter again: Row over Chiranjeevi's sexist remark Actor Chiranjeevi drew criticism over his 'sexist' remark about wanting a grandson to continue his family's legacy. The South megastar said he is scared his son Ram Charan might have a daughter again.

Zelenskyy says Ukraine ready to swap territory with Russia but on one conditionUkraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said his country is ready to give Ukrainian-held Kursk in exchange for the Russian-occupied territories in Ukraine if US President Donald Trump is able to strike a deal to end the nearly three-year conflict.

AAP's Amanatullah Khan to Delhi top cop: Not hiding, being framed in false caseA case has been registered against Amanatullah Khan for allegedly obstructing a police operation to arrest an accused in a murder case. The Delhi Police have launched a manhunt to arrest the Okhla AAP MLA.

Amid 90-hour work week debate, Andhra's big work from home push: Can empower womenAndhra Pradesh Chief Minister's initiative, part of the state's IT & GCC policy 4.0, aims to enhance women's participation through work models that foster better work-life balance and employment opportunities across cities, towns, and rural areas.

Deepika Padukone recalls depression battle: At one point, I didn't want to liveActor Deepika Padukone recalled her battle with depression in the Pariksha Pe Charcha special episode. During the show, the actor discussed how Indian society had a mental health stigma.

At Paris AI Summit, PM Modi calls for bias-free data: Need to think carefullyAt the AI Action Summit in Paris, Prime Minister Narendra Modi called for efforts to develop open-source systems that promote trust and transparency, and emphasised the need to democratise technology.

'Chill, don't drill', says Deepika Padukone on exam stress in Pariksha Pe CharchaBollywood star Deepika Padukone engaged with students in Pariksha Pe Charcha, discussing mental health and ways to manage exam stress. She emphasized the importance of self-care, open communication, and focusing on aspects within one's control.

Influencer Apoorva Mukhija appears before cops amid Ranveer Allahbadia controversyRanveer Allahbadia, with over 10 million subscribers on his BeerBiceps YouTube channel, has been widely criticised for his obscene jokes on comedian Samay Raina's 'India's Got Latent' show, with multiple complaints being filed against him alleging vulgarity.

Delivery app's 'India's Lost Talent' ad on Ranveer Allahbadia, Samay Raina is viralFood delivery app Magicpin shared an advertisement featuring animated characters resembling panellists from India's Got Latent on social media.

We're here for the comments on Aravind Srinivas and Sundar Pichai's viral picSundar Pichai and Aravind Srinivas are in Paris for the AI Action Summit that brought together world leaders, tech executives, and lawmakers to discuss AI's future and impact.

Transplanting both hands: Amrita Hospital doctors perform complex surgeryThe operation involved four surgical teams and specialists in nephrology, ophthalmology, and critical care to coordinate complex medical procedures.

Why Indian couples are hiring wedding social media managersIndia is witnessing a rising trend of hiring social media managers, the digital ninjas who not only help couples go viral but also capture precious moments that might otherwise be missed, and then turn it all into a stunning digital wedding diary and engaging social media content.

Rajnath Singh's witty advice to Siddaramaiah: Take care of your legs from…Invest Karnataka-2025 summit: In a display of political camaraderie tinged with humour, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, who suffered a knee injury, to be mindful of "stumbling blocks everywhere" in politics.

Ayodhya Ram Temple's chief priest dies after hospitalisation due to strokeAcharya Satyendra Das was hospitalised on Sunday after suffering a brain stroke. His cremation will take place in Ayodhya on Thursday.

Vir Das discusses good comedy vs good journalism amid Ranveer Allahbadia rowComedian Vir Das criticised Indian newsrooms and asked people to encourage the new media amid the backlash that podcaster Ranveer Allahbadia and comedian Samay Raina are facing for a 'joke' on India's Got Latent.

Sam Altman's 'insecurity' dig at Elon Musk amid OpenAI bid: I feel for the guyElon Musk and Sam Altman, who co-founded OpenAI in 2015 and later clashed over its leadership, have been in a longstanding feud over the company's direction.

Jasprit Bumrah was 'okay' for Champions Trophy, but selectors didn't want to take riskJasprit Bumrah was reportedly deemed 'okay' by the National Cricket Academy, but the BCCI selection committee decided not to take a risk with the star pacer for the upcoming Champions Trophy. Bumrah was omitted frpm the squad for the tournament on Tuesday, February 11.

With Elon Musk by his side, Trump gives DOGE more power to make staff cutsElon Musk and his son, X Æ A-Xii, whom the tech billionaire refers to as Little X, stood alongside Donald Trump in the Oval Office as the President signed the order to give DOGE more power to shrink the federal workforce by making large staff cuts.

BTS' V named world's most handsome man. Hrithik Roshan, Brad Pitt also on listBTS singer V aka Kim Taehyung has been named as the world's most handsome man. The list also features Indian actor Hrithik Roshan, Hollywood stars Brad Pitt, Tom Cruise, Bradley Cooper, among others.

Chhaava box office prediction: Rs 12-15 crore opening for Vicky Kaushal filmTrade experts predict a Rs 12–15 crore opening for Chhaava. With 2 lakh tickets sold at PVR Inox, Maharashtra will be key to its success. Word of mouth could push its opening weekend to Rs 40–50 crore.

Assam's mobile theatre: Where stage meets cinema in a spectacle of innovationMobile theatres in Assam have revolutionised the cinema viewing experience. It's creative, contemporary, and also seems like a brilliant attempt at preserving the artistic culture of the state.

Kichcha Sudeep's Max to premiere on TV ahead of OTT releaseAhead of its highly-anticipated OTT release, Kichcha Sudeep's Max will have its world television premiere. Max released in theatres on December 25.

Are depleted RCB equipped enough to defend crown? WPL 2025: Smriti Mandhana's Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) are the defending champions, but are a tad unsettled due to players pulling out of the competition for various reasons.

Watch: 'Babar, Babar' chants echo at Karachi stadium, leave Pakistan star emotionalFormer captain Babar Azam was met with loud cheers as he spoke during the inaugural ceremony of the newly renovated National Stadium in Karachi. Pakistan will begin their Champions Trophy campaign at this venue on February 19.

Don't bench Kuldeep for Varun in Champions Trophy: Aakash ChopraAakash Chopra has urged the Indian team management not to drop Kuldeep Yadav for Varun Chakravarthy during the ICC Champions Trophy 2025. Kuldeep has been India's main spinner in the last 2 ICC events.

Australian spinner reported for suspected illegal bowling action Australia's left-arm spinner Matthew Kuhnemann was reported for suspected illegal bowling action after his series-winning performance in Sri Lanka. If found illegal, Kuhnemann will be banned from bowling.

Afghanistan's Allah Ghazanfar set to miss Champions Trophy 2025 and IPL due to injuryAfghanistan suffered a big blow ahead of the Champions Trophy 2025 as the young spinner was ruled out of the tournament due to an injury. Ghazanfar will miss the IPL 2025 season due to the injury.

IND vs ENG, 3rd ODI: Will Arshdeep get a chance before Champions Trophy?IND vs ENG: India might want to have a look at fast bowlers Arshdeep Singh and all-rounder Washington Sundar in the third ODI against England before heading to Dubai for the Champions Trophy. This will be the final chance for India to test their bench strength.

IND vs ENG, 3rd ODI: India's final chance to fine-tune side before Champions TrophyIndia will play one last game against England before flying out for the Champions Trophy. With Jasprit Bumrah being ruled out of the upcoming ICC event, the final match of the series is the last opportunity for the Indian team to get their house in order before flying out to Dubai.

No place for Siraj? Gambhir slammed for big call in Champions Trophy squadIndian cricket fans were seen going after head coach Gautam Gambhir-led team management for not selecting Mohammed Siraj in the final squad for ICC Champions Trophy 2025. Siraj was named as a non-travelling reserve for the tournament.

Champions Trophy 2025: Mitchell Starc pulls out, Steve Smith to lead AustraliaMitchell Starc has decided to withdraw from the Champions Trophy 2025 as Australia announced their squad for the event on Wednesday, February 12. Steve Smith will be leading the Aussies in the event as they will miss their big 3 pacers.

Fans question Yashasvi Jaiswal's omission from India squad Champions Trophy: Fans weren't happy after Yashasvi Jaiswal was left out of the Indian squad after being given a chance in only a solitary ODI against England at the VCA Stadium in Nagpur.

Bumrah ruled out as India finalise spin-heavy Champions Trophy squadChampions Trophy: Fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah couldn't recover in time from his back injury and missed out on a berth in the Indian squad for the upcoming eight-time tournament. Riyan Parag breaks silence on Ananya Pandey and Sara Ali Khan search controversyIndia cricketer Riyan Parag has broken his silence on his search history controversy from 2024 about Bollywood actors Ananya Pandey and Sara Ali Khan.

Kapil Dev backs Mohammed Shami to be at his menacing best in Champions TrophyLegendary India all rounder Kapil Dev has backed Mohammed Shami to be at his usual best in the upcoming ICC Champions Trophy 2025. He also shared his views on the possibility of Jasprit Bumrah missing the tournament.

Pakistan vs South Africa Live Streaming: When and where to watch? Pakistan and South Africa will lock horns in the last and final league match of the ongoing tri-series on Wednesday, February 12 at the National Stadium in Karachi. Both teams lost to New Zealand earlier in the series.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
